summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 9, 2019. It lists inmate movements, status changes (like bail/bond releases, hospital transfers, and pre-removals), and administrative actions. The log is significant as it shows the operational activity at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily log of inmate movements, status changes (bail/bond, hospital transfers, pre-removals), and administrative actions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

keyFacts: This document is a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for August 9, 2019.
The log details routine inmate movements and status changes, including actions labeled 'BAIL/BOND', 'HOSP USM' (hospital, U.S. Marshals), 'PRE REMOVE', and 'ADM CHANGE' (administrative change).

The document is part of the Epstein case files, indicating it is likely from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death on August 10, 2019, though his name does not appear on this specific daily log page.
The log shows standard prison administrative operations, tracking inmates via registration numbers and codes for different housing units and actions.
The document's original source is the BOP's SENTRY system, accessed via a specific DOJ web address.
